item.title: Working with native code easily in C# with the help of C++/CLI
item.description: .NET comes with pretty good interoperability options which would enable unmanaged code to be used from a managed environment. In C#, to call a function which is available in a DLL, PInvoke (Platform invocation service) can be used. Here is what MSDN says. Platform Invocation Services (PInvoke) allows managed code to call unmanaged functions that are implemented in a DLL. This is very helpful when you need to call some system functions from your C# application.
